briefdescription.para: Convenience constructor to create a new storage manager with some settings without having to fill a 'spec' Record.

detaileddescription.para:
The storage manager will be initialized to AF normalization with a truncated Gaussian distribution for the quantization, and a truncation of sigma = 2.5. To change the settings, use one of the Set...Distribution() methods and SetNormalization().
dataBitRate
The number of bits per float used for visibilities.
weightBitRate
The number of bits per float used for the weight column.
name
Storage manager name.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the storage manager to use a Gaussian distribution for the quantization.

detaileddescription.para: This method should only be called directly after creating DyscoStMan, before adding columns, and reading/writing data.

In tests with MWA and LOFAR data, the Gaussian distribution showed lesser compression accuracy compared to the truncated Gaussian and uniform distributions.
SetUniformDistribution(), SetTruncatedGaussianDistribution()

briefdescription.para: Initialize the storage manager to use a Uniform distribution for the quantization (i.e., use a linear quantizer).

detaileddescription.para: This method should only be called directly after creating DyscoStMan, before adding columns, and reading/writing data.
In tests with MWA and LOFAR data, the Uniform distribution showed very good results, only the truncated Gaussian distribution showed better results for some cases.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the storage manager to use a Student T distribution for the quantization (i.e., use a linear quantizer).

detaileddescription.para: This method should only be called directly after creating DyscoStMan, before adding columns, and reading/writing data.
The Student T distribution performed not very well on test sets, and was mainly added for testing.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the storage manager to use a Uniform distribution for the quantization (i.e., use a linear quantizer).

detaileddescription.para: This method should only be called directly after creating DyscoStMan, before adding columns, and reading/writing data.

In tests with MWA and LOFAR data, the truncated Gaussian distribution with a sigma of 1.5 to 2.5 is the recommended distribution.
truncationSigma
At which point the distribution is truncated. Good values are 1.5 to 2.5.

briefdescription.para: Set the type of normalization.

detaileddescription.para: This method should only be called directly after creating DyscoStMan, before adding columns, and reading/writing data.

briefdescription.para: This constructor is called by Casa when it needs to create a DyscoStMan.

detaileddescription.para:
Casa will call makeObject() that will call this constructor. When it loads an DyscoStMan for an existing MS, the "spec" parameter will be empty, thus the class should initialize its properties by reading them from the file. The spec is used to make a new storage manager with specs similar to another one.
name
Name of this storage manager.
spec
Specs to initialize this class with.

briefdescription.para: Copy constructor that initializes a storage manager with similar specs.

detaileddescription.para: The columns are not copied: the new manager will be empty.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
Assignment new dyscostman takes the settings of the source (but not the columns and/or data).
Polymorphical copy constructor, equal to DyscoStMan(const DyscoStMan&).

simplesect.para: Empty manager with specs as the source.

briefdescription.para: Type of manager.
Returns the name of this manager as specified during construction.
Get manager specifications.

detaileddescription.para:
Includes method settings, etc. Can be used to make a second storage manager with
Record containing data manager specifications.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of rows in the measurement set.

simplesect.para: Number of rows in the measurement set.

briefdescription.para: Whether rows can be added.
Whether rows can be removed.

simplesect.para: true (but only rows at the end can actually be removed)

briefdescription.para: Whether columns can be added.

simplesect.para: true (but restrictions apply; columns can only be added as long as no writes have been performed on the set).

briefdescription.para: Whether columns can be removed.

simplesect.para: true (but restrictions apply still to be checked)

briefdescription.para: Create an object with given name and spec.

detaileddescription.para:
This methods gets registered in the DataManager "constructor" map. The caller has to delete the object. New class will be initialized via DyscoStMan(const casacore::String& name, const casacore::Record& spec).
A DyscoStMan with given specs.

briefdescription.para: This function makes the DyscoStMan known to casacore.

detaileddescription.para: The function is necessary for loading the storage manager from a shared library. It should have this specific name ("register_" + storage manager's name in lowercase) to be able to be automatically called when the library is loaded. That function will forward the call here.

briefdescription.para: The number of rows that are actually stored in the file.

detaileddescription.para: This method is synchronized (i.e., thread-safe).

briefdescription.para: Number of rows in one "time-block", i.e.

detaileddescription.para:
a sequence of rows that belong to the same timestep, spw and field. This value is only available after a first time block was written (see areOffsetsInitialized()).
Number of measurement set rows in one time block.

briefdescription.para: Number of antennae used in a time block.

detaileddescription.para:
This does not have to be equal to the number of antennae stored in the measurement set. This value is only available after a first time block was written (see areOffsetsInitialized()).
Number of antennae.

briefdescription.para: Return index of block that contains the given measurement set row.

detaileddescription.para:
This can only be calculated after a first time block was written (see areOffsetsInitialized()).
row
A measurement set row.
Block index.

briefdescription.para: Return the offset of the row within the block.

detaileddescription.para:
This can only be calculated after a first time block was written (see areOffsetsInitialized()).
getBlockIndex().
row
A measurement set row.
offset of row within block.

briefdescription.para: Calculate first measurement set row index of a given block index.

simplesect.para: First measurement set row index of given block.

briefdescription.para: This method returns true when the number of rows per block and the number of antennae per block are known.

detaileddescription.para:
This is only the case once the first time- block was written to the file.
True when the nr of rows per block and antennae are available.

briefdescription.para: To be called by a column once it determines rowsPerBlock and antennaCount.

parameterdescription.para: Number of measurement set rows in one time block.
Highest antenna index+1 used in a time block.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t blockIndex, const DyscoStManColumn *column, unsigned char *dest, size_t size)
memberdef.name: readCompressedData

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t blockIndex, const DyscoStManColumn *column, const unsigned char *data, size_t size)
memberdef.name: writeCompressedData

memberdef.argsstring: (const casacore::String &name, int dataType, const casacore::String &dataTypeID) final override
memberdef.name: makeScalarColumn

memberdef.argsstring: (const casacore::String &name, int dataType, const casacore::String &dataTypeID) final override
memberdef.name: makeDirArrColumn

memberdef.argsstring: (const casacore::String &name, int dataType, const casacore::String &dataTypeID) final override
memberdef.name: makeIndArrColumn

briefdescription.para: The main class for the Dysco storage manager.
